Tonight is the last two episodes of "24". Jack Bauer will once again save America from the clutches of the dastardly terrorist "Marwan" who has launched a nuclear missile somewhere in the United States. President David Palmer has been brought back to help run the operation out of CTU and we all have our future in the hands of just one man (Jack Bauer) who must obtain the information to locate the cruise missile on its way to an unspecified city in America. Set your DVRs right now -- before you do another thing. It comes on at 7 PM Central Daylight time on Fox (Dish channel 8403). Two hours. Don't miss it. It will also provide a clue as to next year's episodes. 
 
 Thought you would want to know. 
 
 In the event you haven't seen this the first two seasons are now avaiable for rent at your local movie store. And the third season is available on DVD for sale. I purchased that at Wal-Mart and resold it on Amazon. Great entertainment. Will keep you on the edge of your seats. Very addictive.

I love this show and cant wait for the finale today.
 Theres the "House" finally tomorrow which ought to be good as well.

These sorts of shows make me wonder how many Americans base their worldview and political opinions on television dramas like West Wing, Law & Order, stuff like that.
 
 Does this episode of this show involving some "terrorist" using a nuclear weapon on the US stir up fear in some of its viewers? And do they subconsciously bring that to the voting booth?

 Does this episode of this show involving some "terrorist" using a nuclear weapon on the US stir up fear in some of its viewers? And do they subconsciously bring that to the voting booth?

 
 Fox went "politically correct" after the first few episodes. CAIR went ballistic and said that the series was picking on Muslim fanatics. So Fox backed off and some of the fanatics became "good guys" in the end.

These sorts of shows make me wonder how many Americans base their worldview and political opinions on television dramas like West Wing, Law & Order, stuff like that.
 
 Does this episode of this show involving some "terrorist" using a nuclear weapon on the US stir up fear in some of its viewers? And do they subconsciously bring that to the voting booth?

 
 It doesn't take much to focus the general public, be it entertainment or politics.
